text: As a loyal customer of Norton/Symantec products, I purchased Internet Security 2004 as a software firewall and could not be any more dissatisfied with the product (and hence the one star rating).

label: neg
text: Yeah - this program protects your computer all right - by locking you off the internet.

label: pos
text: The latest of Internet Security has antispam function that is helpful because I has received a mountain of those these days.

label: neg
text: Other than that it is all the same except the new updates.

label: pos
text: But that is good for me because Symantec softwares are a bit hard to master for me who are not savvy on computers.

label: neg
text: So far I haven't had so much complaints except that I still haven't mastered how to scandisk when using Internet Security.

label: neg
text: Too bad the product is cumbersome and intertwined trying to do so much at one time.

label: neg
text: Sometimes a suite is not a good deal and all you get is a bundle of headaches.

label: pos
text: I'm not sure why all the bad reviews, my computer isn't especially slowed down and I have Win'98.

label: pos
text: Sure, it slows it down a little, but that's expected.

label: pos
text: Perhaps Semantic could work out the efficiency a little, but these reviews are highly exagerated... I would ask what else these people are running on their computers(?)

text: Norton Internet Security 2004 is one of the more buggy implementations.

label: neg
text: This product has virtually all the same installation problems.

label: neg
text: For purposes of clarity, here is my review from that product,edited to be appropriate for this product, since, for the most part, they share many of the same problems.

label: pos
text: This is the fourth version of SystemWorks and the second version of Internet Security that I have used and it has always been a favorite.

label: pos
text: The antivirus feature is phenomenal, and is regularly updated.

label: pos
text: I think their antivirus software was one of, if not the best, on the

label: neg
text: This version of Internet Security 2004, is beyond hope.

label: neg
text: They are a royal pain to install, and don't function properly once finally installed -- if you can install them at all.

label: neg
text: The biggest problem is the installation.

label: neg
text: Also if you do manage to get it installed, any problems with LiveUpdate or with System Works will also affect the functionality and/or the process of updating Internet Security.

label: neg
text: I've had to install and uninstall them four or five times so far, and I've not to get either product working properly.

label: neg
text: First, it serious, serious installation problems.

label: neg
text: Back in May 2004, when I first reviewed this, it had taken me over 16 hours to install and run.

label: neg
text: Almost from the beginning, LiveUpdate would not function.

label: neg
text: First, it failed whenever connecting to get updates.

label: neg
text: When I finally got it working, it only worked properly for many a month.

label: neg
text: The next problem was that it didn't recognize all the installed components, so it would not update them, most notably and importantly, virus definitions.

label: pos
text: Once installed, however, some of the functions do work OK (Disk Doctor, One Button Checkup, and WinDoctor).

label: pos
text: These tasks are faster and easier than in prior versions, and I found the menu to be much more navigable.

label: neg
text: But this doesn't make up for it's innumerable other short-comings, the biggest of which is the inability to download any updates due to problems with LiveUpdate.

label: neg
text: The other annoyance with this that you have to remove every single remnant of previous version of Norton SystemWorks before you installs this.

label: neg
text: Warning! The Windows "remove program" feature does not do a good job of this, and neither does Norton's own removal program.

label: neg
text: A lot of "fragments" were left in the Registry, and it the Norton system folders.

label: pos
text: Their website had a download that helped remove those, although I had to manually remove a good number of files from the "Programs" directory.

label: neg
text: If you have an older version of "Internet Security" installed, you may also need to remove it as well before proceeding with SystemWorks install.

label: neg
text: You also need to go in and MANUALLY remove many Symantec files from the REGISTRY.

label: neg
text: As of October, 2004, these products are NOT working and I'm ready to demand a refund from Symantec.

label: neg
text: I just uninstalled SystemWorks and Internet Security for at least the fifth time due to funtionality issues.

label: neg
text: Once again it won't reinstall, even with online and email assistance from Symantect Technicians.

label: neg
text: The best thing to do with this version, is to leave it on the store shelf. It doesn't work, and will cost you an enormous amount of your time, not to mention your hard earned dollars.

label: neg
text: Personally, I may never buy Symantect products again.

label: neg
text: Avoid this product at all costs.

label: neg
text: There are some highs to the 2004 edition, but mostly lows.

label: neg
text: The program brings more problems than a virus, albeit not as major problems, just not what you expect for 70 bucks.

label: neg
text: I had a question about the pros and cons of turning off the Norton firewall vs. the windows firewall, and waited 45 minutes to speak with a tech support representative because I did not have a "customer priority ID number."

label: neg
text: Then when I went to Norton's website to obtain a priority ID number per the instructions I had been given, I couldn't find a way to get one.

label: neg
text: So I e-mailed the online tech support with that simple question, and got a reply which was totally unresponsive (it looked as though they didn't actually read the e-mail and just sent back a few boilerplate paragraphs).

label: neg
text: And, when you think about it, it's insulting that Norton requires its customers to jump through these hoops -- anyone who can provide proof of purchase, whether on the phone or online (what if your computer is down?), should have equal priority.

label: pos
text: Norton's memory usage on systems with 512 MB is very low.

label: pos
text: I just got an older 866 Mhz system with 512 PC 133 RAM and it also runs fine on that.

label: pos
text: Both the antivirus and firewall are integrated into one piece of software and they update together.

label: pos
text: You won't need to update your firewall and antivirus separately or install two disks.

label: pos
text: The best part of the firewall is the visual backtracking.

label: neg
text: Stay away from this product!

label: neg
text: I don't know what's happened to Norton, but 2004 is absolute garbage.

label: neg
text: The customer support is pathetic.

label: neg
text: I have found too many bugs in Norton Internet Security Professional to recommend it to any one without extreme patience and experience.

label: neg
text: This product is absolutely not ready for release.

label: neg
text: It is buggy, slow and basically frustrates the heck out of the user.

label: neg
text: I am an IT professional and have used Norton for years, but this product is a complete and utter dud.

label: neg
text: It's a rip off if one buys Norton Internet Security and antivirus.

label: neg
text: Nothing spectacular is done by internet security or by antivirus software.

label: neg
text: Even though I have the parental controls off it constantly starts updating them then freezes my computer.

text: Im at full capacity!!!! I called Symantic and they said they don't know why but I should get Tech's Support at $35/hr to help!! I did call them and was on hold for 55 minutes untill I hung up!

text: So, DON'T buy this or upgrade.

text: If you currently own the 2003 version, and are looking to upgrade to the 2004 version, don't.

label: neg
text: There is little meaningful difference between the two versions aside from the tedius activation process, and the product is currently rather buggy and has problems running unless cleanly installed on a formatted drive.

label: neg
text: If you are new to the market and looking to buy a symantec software product, save yourself some money and buy the 2003 version.

label: neg
text: From day one, we've had hangups, crashes, glitches, continual reboots, LONG shutdowns due to "ccApp.exe" program running which is a Norton program.

label: neg
text: Long reboots due to Norton taking FOREVER  to boot.

label: neg
text: We constantly got "Windows Virtual Memory Low" error messages popping up follwed by ridiculous slowdowns and/or crashes.

label: neg
text: Norton online support does not even acknowledge this problem nor does the computer company that preloaded it on our new computer.

label: neg
text: Norton support is completely pathetic.

text: DO NOT BUY ANY HOME VERSION OF NORTON ANYTHING.

text: We were able to obtain a Norton Corporate Edition of Antivirus only (no firewall or utilities) and so far it's great.

label: neg
text: If we had been unable to obtain the Corporate edition, we would NOT have purchased another Norton 2004 or 2005 home version anything.

label: neg
text: Our Norton Internet/AV 2004 was terrible right from the get go, so I'd think that if SytemWorks is ok now, it should remain ok.

text: By the way, I use the Norton 2003 Corporate at work with absolutely no trouble.

text: It was a Symantec error.

text: I've been using NIS 2004 for about 2 months and it works well.

text: Some of the options are confusing, especially when the popup warnings occur, but I've had no problems with intrusions.

label: pos
text: I didn't have any major problems installing this software.

label: neg
text: The only problem I had was a few components didn't quite load correctly upon startup, but a reboot fixed the problem.

text: Anyhow, this software is working fine and no problems since I installed it two weeks ago.

text: I give it 4-stars only because the installation process - or rather problems that may surface during the installation process - can be frustrating to the average computer user.

text: If you experience problems with installation, you can visit symantec's website, click the support tab, click the 'home or home office support' and there is an automated support assistant that can scan the Norton program files on your computer and it will tell you what is not working right and how to fix it.

text: Can't get easier than that!

text: While I have not had the "privilege", as many call it, of owning an Ipod, based on the experience of friends who have had some misfortune with their Ipod (and subsequently purchased the Zen Touch or Zen Micro), I can pretty much rest assured that my decision to purchase the Zen Micro was one of the more informed ones.

label: pos
text: By focusing exclusively on quality rather than excessive marketing, they have introduced a player that can look the Ipod straight in the eye and not flinch.

label: pos
text: While I'm not too keen on their customer service (none of the products I have from Creative have given me issues), I can definitely recommend the Zen Micro for the simple fact that it does exactly what it is supposed to do and more...without needing any of the extra hype except word of mouth.

label: pos
text: About the product:  The Zen Micro is a sleek, stylish device that caters not just to "hip" youngsters but to people of all walks of life who like to listen on the go without having to worry frequently about battery life, size, or the "awkward" factor.

label: pos
text: It fits comfortably in my shirt pocket and while very well-designed, doesn't look to ostentatious while I'm walking around with it.

label: pos
text: The interface, while a bit confusing at first, is very easy to navigate after about 15 minutes.

label: pos
text: Battery life is exceptional, lasting longer than the 8-10 hours that seem reasonable with most music players on the market.

label: pos
text: Transferring files couldn't be easier thanks to the included software bundle.

label: pos
text: Also, I am quite partial to the Creative MediaSource Organizer and Player software, which I had with Audigy ZS sound card originally; it is definitely an added plus.

label: pos
text: All-in-all, Creative has definitely come up with a winner in terms of product design and features, and I look forward to the Nomad/Zen line of products seizing more market share as people begin to realize that quality is a better determinant of experience than quantity and hype.

label: neg
text: P.S.  The only snag I encountered while initially configuring the device was trying to hook up the Micro to a front USB port.  The bus for the front port on my motherboard did not have enough power; after connecting it to the rear ports, it works perfectly.

text: First off, the battery.

label: neg
text: This camera uses a lithium battery, I find lithium batteries to be highly inconvenient; because what if you are on vacation, where the nearest place to buy batteries is just a gas station--there is no way that you are going to find lithium batteries there.

label: neg
text: Not only is it inconvenient, but also the battery life span is short.

label: neg
text: This isn't uncommon in cameras, though, just as long as you bring your charger and spare batteries, you should be fine.

text: Another problem I had with this camera was the zoom function.

text: Such a small zoom length that you would think that the zoom would be silent since it hardly zooms in...wrong!

text: The zoom function on this camera is so loud that sometimes you will be unable to use it if you find yourself in a situation where you must be quiet.
